etymology.description: 服(服) (fú, "serve; obey; clothes") + 務(務) (wù, "affairs; duties; to attend to") = to serve or attend to duties + 員(員) (yuán, "member; person engaged in a field") = person engaged in serving duties
etymology.interpretation: A 服務員(服务员) (fúwùyuán) is someone whose duty is to serve others, commonly seen in hospitality contexts such as restaurants and cafes. The word encapsulates the idea of attending to others' needs as a member of the service industry.

parts.english: member; person engaged in a field

examples.chinese: 服务员很好(服務員很好)。
那位服务员总是笑着(那位服務員總是笑著)，让客人感觉温暖(讓客人感覺溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Nà wèi fúwùyuán zǒngshì xiào zhe, ràng kèrén gǎnjué wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: That waiter always smiles, making the guests feel warm.

examples.chinese: 服务员很忙(服務員很忙)，但仍耐心服务(但仍耐心服務)。
examples.pinyin: Fúwùyuán hěn máng, dàn réng nàixīn fúwù.
examples.english: The waiter is busy, but still serves patiently.
